ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and soaring date-palms with layered spathes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And tall date-palms with their spathes pile on pile
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered spathes;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and tall palm-trees with clusters of dates
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And high date-palms with lush fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And date palms Basiqat, with arranged clusters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the tall palm-trees having spadices closely set one above another,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and tall palm-trees with spathes compact,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And lofty date-palms with ranged clusters,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered dates,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And tall date-palms laden with clusters ranged.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and tall date palms with regularly set spathes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And tall (and stately) palm-trees, with shoots of fruit-stalks, piled one over another;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And tall date-palms, with ranged clusters;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and tall palmtrees with compact spathes
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the soaring palm trees, with clustered dates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:10] and the date-palms that stand tall (bāsiqātin, is an implied [future] circumstantial qualifier) with piled spathes, one [cluster of dates] sitting on top of the other,
